name: AI Vision Project
description: First-to-market cloud AI vision system with real-time multi-model processing, rule-based orchestration, and natural language querying

phases.name: POC & Architecture Validation
deliverables: Cloud infrastructure setup (AWS S3, Kafka, PostgreSQL)

phases.name: Core Development - Phase 1
deliverables: 5-7 AI models integration (YOLO v8, BLIP, OCR, CLIP)

overview.problem: Industries need real-time AI vision analytics at scale but existing solutions lack multi-model orchestration, intelligent frame processing, and natural language querying capabilities in a cloud-native architecture
overview.valueProposition: First cloud-native AI vision platform with intelligent multi-model orchestration, processing 30 FPS streams through 5-7 specialized models, with natural language querying and real-time analytics
overview.strategicImportance: Establishes Fuelers as pioneer in cloud AI vision with unique rule-based model orchestration, positioning for rapid market capture in untapped segment with scalable microservices architecture

features.name: Multi-Model Processing
features.description: 5-7 specialized AI models (expandable to 15) with intelligent orchestration

features.name: Rule-Based Engine
features.description: Smart model selection per frame based on business rules

features.name: Real-time Analytics
features.description: Process 30 FPS video streams with sub-second latency

features.name: Natural Language Queries
features.description: Ask questions about video data using GPT-4 integration

features.name: Vector Search
features.description: Semantic search across video content using embeddings

features.name: Graph Relations
features.description: Discover relationships between detected objects and events

screenshots.title: Real-time Dashboard
screenshots.description: Live video processing with multi-model results

screenshots.title: Natural Language Query
screenshots.description: Ask questions about video content in plain English

diagram.title: AI Vision Microservices Architecture
diagram.description: Complete cloud-native pipeline from camera feed to LLM-powered insights

team.note: Ahmed Mohammed - Model optimization and rule engine

constraints: Data retention and storage cost optimization

currentStatus.summary: POC completed with 50% overall progress. Microservices architecture validated with Python + Golang stack. Core challenges: rule-based engine for multi-model orchestration, data retention strategy, pricing model finalization, and production backend deployment.
achievements: Validated frame processing pipeline at 30 FPS
Integrated core AI models (YOLO v8, BLIP, OCR, CLIP)
Established cloud infrastructure (AWS S3, Kafka, PostgreSQL)
Implemented initial vector and graph database integration
Created LLM query interface prototype with GPT-4

risks.risk: Rule-based engine complexity for orchestrating 5-7 models per frame
risks.mitigation: Dedicated data scientist (Ahmed Mohammed) focusing on intelligent model selection algorithm and performance optimization

risks.risk: Data retention and storage costs at 30 FPS processing scale
risks.mitigation: Data engineer implementing tiered storage strategy and retention policies

risks.risk: Pricing model complexity for multi-tenant and on-prem deployments
risks.mitigation: Business analysis for usage-based pricing with tenant management system
Full team of 10 members with incremental delivery approach and experienced team lead (Tirlok)

blockers: Pricing model finalization required for tenant management implementation
Data retention policy decisions needed for storage architecture
Production backend deployment pending full team allocation

planned: Finalize rule-based engine for model orchestration (3 weeks)
Complete data retention and storage strategy (2 weeks)
Implement pricing model and tenant management (2 weeks)
Deploy production-grade backend with full team (4 weeks)
Launch with 5-7 models (expandable to 15 models post-launch)
boardAsks: Approval for $80K budget ($40K/month for 2 months) with phase breakdown
Decision on pricing model: usage-based vs. subscription vs. hybrid
Strategic direction: cloud-first vs. on-premise deployment priority
Resource allocation approval for 10-member team (4 Golang, 2 Python, 1 Data Engineer, 1 Data Scientist, 1 DevOps, 1 PM)
IP protection and patent strategy for rule-based orchestration engine
